thread.section_title: Technology News & Analysis - Wall Street Journal
thread.title: Cataloging the World’s Cyberforces - WSJ

author: Jennifer Valentino-DeVries
title: Cataloging the World’s Cyberforces - WSJ
text:
More than 60 countries have or are developing tools for computer espionage and attacks. The world is shrouded in secrecy, and the hackers involved are notoriously difficult to track, making certainty and comprehensiveness impossible. The Wall Street Journal consulted public sources, computer security experts and researchers to compile estimates on this new arms race.
The Journal’s research shows:
29 countries now have formal military or intelligence units dedicated to offensive cyberefforts. 49 countries have bought... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In
